intro: Deilosma alpinum, commonly known as the alpine deilosma, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, adapted to withstand cold and windy conditions. Deilosma alpinum is often found in alpine meadows and is considered an indicator species of high-altitude ecosystems.
